title: George Michael's lover Fadi Fawaz 'horrified' at having to relive harrowing 999 call
text:
Celebs George Michael's lover Fadi Fawaz 'horrified' at having to relive harrowing 999 call Fadi is horrified at the emergence of the tape in which he tells an ambulance call handler: “He’s gone. He’s blue. He’s dead.” Share By Sharon Feinstein Janine Yaqoob Dan Warburton 22:30, 11 FEB 2017 Fadi Fawaz is horrified at having to relive the call (Photo: Steve Bainbridge) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Looking red-eyed and haunted, Fadi Fawaz leaves home, just hours after the release of the 999 call he made when he found his lover George Michael dead in bed. 
Fadi is horrified at the emergence of the tape in which he tells an ambulance call handler: “He’s gone. He’s blue. He’s dead.” 
The four-and-a-half minute call was made by Fadi after he found the lifeless singer, aged 53, on Christmas Day. 
Fadi said: “It’s ­horrifying. What’s going on?” 
A pal added: “Fadi’s heartbroken he’s having to relive the morning he discovered George with the release of this tape. Fadi found George Michael dead in his bed (Photo: Getty) 
“He’s finding it hard enough to grieve and now he is having to relive that harrowing call over and over again.” 
Solicitors acting for George Michael’s family released a statement about the 999 call, saying: “George’s family and friends are extremely upset and truly appalled that such a personal, painful and clearly confidential recording has been leaked. 
“We will be ensuring a full investigation takes place to establish how this material was made available and will expect the culprit(s) to be dealt with appropriately.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Fadi Fawaz's 999 call after George Michael's death Share this video Watch Next 
Police told the Sunday Mirror that it would still be several weeks before the star’s body is released. 
That raises fears the funeral may not take place until March – a delay which the family say they are finding “intolerable”. 
Fadi, a fine art photographer, was told by police earlier this month that he is no longer part of their probe into the singer’s death in Foring, Oxfordshire. 
Vasilis Panayi, a Greek radio host, said George’s dad Kyriacos Panayiotou had struggled to leave his house since his son’s death. Fadi Fawaz and George Michael 
He said: “It’s very hard for all of them, quite intolerable. It’s a shock and terrible for his father. 
“He was looking forward to a happy old age and now all he has is grief. He wants to hold the funeral but so far police are ­refusing to release the body and are looking for further clues. 
“I spoke to him before George died and he told me he wanted to try to bring his son back into his community and change his mindset. 
He wanted him to become part of the lifestyle of the community and it is possible this would have saved George.” Flowers at George Michael's Highgate house (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
Another friend, Demetri Louca, revealed: “George’s body is still with the coroner in Oxfordshire. His family are finding the wait intolerable. 
“His body will be there until they have found the cause of death and apparently it is very nearly finished now. 
“They are planning the funeral with the high priest and will announce the date in time and not long. 
The Greek community is very important to the family and they believe that if George had been part of it this, his sad early death would never have happened.” Musicians George Michael and Sir Elton John (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Police are continuing to probe George’s last hours and the moments after he died at home. 
But his family were rocked by the release of Fadi’s frantic 999 call after finding his lover’s lifeless body in bed. 
In it, Fadi is unable to quickly give the full postcode of George’s cottage, saying he is “shaking”. 
The call handler then asks where George’s body is and Fadi replies: “He’s in bed. Dead. He’s cold and he’s blue... yes, he’s very stiff. He’s dead... he’s dead.” Fadi tried to wake George for an hour (Photo: PA) 
Fadi reveals he has spent an hour trying to revive him. The operator goes on to ask if George’s death was “expected”. 
Fadi replies: “No, no, no, no, no, I’ve been waiting for him to wake him up for like, you know, hours and he wouldn’t wake up. I went to wake him up and he was gone, you know.” 
He adds: “It’s George Michael, you know, the singer?” 
Fadi wrongly gives George’s date of birth as July 25 instead of June 25. The operator tells him the ambulance is on its way and not to move the body. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
